metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5160 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebRTC can use a "WrappedI420Buffer" pixel buffer but the owning image object can be freed while it is still in use. This can result in the WebRTC encoder using uninitialized memory, leading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 60.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
